author: peter.davies
content: <@!301186049323958275> I think the way to get a really great experience would be to include an "expiry" field in the transaction header (transactions are invalid in blocks after expiry) and have interfaces default to sending: Max Fee = 2 x Current Base Fee, Priority Fee = 1 GWei, Expiry = 1 min. Then apps just get to show a timer and users are promised that either their transaction succeeded or failed for free (and they can just retry without issues).

author: sky.cactus
content: This has potential to open up some DoS vectors that we would need to analyze and deal with.

author: ghosts_in_the_code
content: I personally don't think UX should be a priority for ethereum upgrades. And DOS protection layers like flashbots will make things better anyway (no cost to failed tx).

author: perama
content: I think the expiry expression could be on the wallet side. You sign a low fee transaction for your wallet, signal that it is for 24 hours. The wallet holds the transaction on their server, and broadcasts if it becomes viable. If it never becomes viable, the mempool never sees it.
